title: What does Best of 2 series mean?
body:
How is that possible? If someone wins the first round then loses the second, what happens then?

I tried googling but found nothing.

replies.body: If an event is using a Bo2 series (should be called a 2 game series) it means that there doesn't necessarily have to be a winner for the series, and instead both teams are playing for points based on wins. So instead of trying to win the series for tournament progression, both teams are trying more to win each game because that will give them points required for tournament progression, usually in a round robin format. A good example of it is Dotapit (I believe) and it's becoming more popular in dota but not really other games.

This is incorrect. What you're describing is a Best of 3.
This is a Best of 2. They play two matches and points are awarded based on results. 2 wins in a series is 3 points, a 1-1 series is 1 point per team, no wins is obviously 0 points.

Thats why China has ties in the standings

(i.e. Vici is something like 4-3-6 right now)
I don't think that's a thing.

Chinese (LPL) runs Series of 2, misrepresented as a Best of 2.

LPL runs a point system for their rankings instead of total match results.
2:0 = 3 Points to the winners 1:1 = 1 Point to each team 0:2 = 0 points to the loser.

This system allows for a more meaningful representation of a teams performance as opposed to 1 game matches, but maybe a bit more confusing than a Best of 3  (like LCK runs).
It's not actually exactly a "best" of 2. Teams can 2-0, 1-1, or 0-2 respectively. There doesn't have to be a winner, it's just a bad name or possible typo.

http://na.lolesports.com/schedule/2015-03-02

It says it right there. On Friday, Master3 vs King. Best of 2 series.
